conditions: During installation or maintenance of the NSA Industrial PC
When handling the power supply connection cable
observed_issues_or_risks: Scratching or forcefully bending the power supply cable
Pulling the cable instead of the connector housing when disconnecting
outcomes_or_consequences: Damaged cable insulation leading to electric shock
Broken internal wires causing overheating or fire
System failure and potential safety hazard

decision_boundaries.description: Electrical shock hazard with potential for serious injury; incorrect handling directly compromises safety systems.
Cable damage may not be visible but can cause latent failure leading to fire when system is operational.

source_reference.section: Safety Precautions, Precautions for Safe Use

conditions: When installing PCI expansion boards for system functionality extension
When determining the ambient operating temperature limits
observed_issues_or_risks: PCI boards generate additional heat (10°C rise at slot 1, 15°C at slot 2)
Operating temperature limits must be derated based on installed boards
Using non-EMC compliant PCI boards requires additional user mitigation measures
outcomes_or_consequences: Premature component failure if temperature limits are exceeded
System instability or shutdown due to overheating
EMC compliance failure requiring expensive retrofits
Need to re-evaluate entire panel cooling design

decision_boundaries.description: Wrong PCI board selection can require complete thermal redesign of the control panel or forced reduction of operating temperatures.

conditions: During scheduled battery replacement (5-year guideline at 25°C)
When RAS board BATLOW indicator is lit
observed_issues_or_risks: RAS board maintenance status data becomes corrupted during battery replacement
Failure to backup data before replacement results in loss of historical logs
Improper battery type or installation causes abnormal operation
outcomes_or_consequences: Loss of critical failure history and operating time data
Inability to analyze failure trends or perform root cause analysis
System may not record future RAS events properly
Need to reset and reconfigure RAS monitoring parameters

decision_boundaries.description: Historical RAS data cannot be recovered once lost; this eliminates ability to perform reliability analysis and trend monitoring.

source_reference.section: 5-1-4 Batteries, Changing the RAS Board Battery

entities.name: NSA Industrial PC power sequence control

conditions: During power cycling or recovery from power interruption
When external input voltage is interrupted and then restored
observed_issues_or_risks: Power OFF/ON interval less than 10 seconds minimum requirement
Power interruption during OS shutdown or other critical operations
No built-in UPS or power interruption recovery functions
outcomes_or_consequences: System may fail to start properly
OS corruption or data loss if interrupted during write operations
Uncompleted operations may leave system in undefined state
Requires external UPS system for reliable operation in unstable power environments

decision_boundaries.description: Uncontrolled shutdown during industrial process control could lead to unsafe plant conditions or production loss.

source_reference.section: 3-4 Starting the Industrial PC and Procedure after Power Interruption

conditions: When configuring the NSA Industrial PC for reliable long-term operation
When deciding between system reliability and write performance
When determining storage configuration for the OS
observed_issues_or_risks: DOM has limited write cycles (100,000 cycles per sector)
EWF reduces available system memory when enabled
D: drive must have EWF disabled to store event logs persistently
Large data writes to DOM with EWF enabled can cause system instability
outcomes_or_consequences: Premature DOM failure if EWF disabled and frequent writes occur
Reduced system performance due to memory constraints with EWF enabled
Need for separate storage (e.g., memory card) for frequent data writes
Trade-off between DOM longevity and system flexibility

decision_boundaries.description: DOM failure requires complete OS reinstallation and potentially system downtime; the EWF decision directly impacts total cost of ownership.

source_reference.section: Appendix 2 Using the Enhanced Write Filter

conditions: When touch panel input becomes misaligned over time
When replacing or servicing the display unit
observed_issues_or_risks: Touch panel requires PS/2 keyboard and mouse connected for calibration
Touch panel coordinates drift over time requiring recalibration
Calibration data stored in EEPROM vs. Windows affects persistence across OS changes
outcomes_or_consequences: Inability to calibrate touch panel if PS/2 devices not available
Erratic touch input leading to operator errors
Need for periodic recalibration as part of preventive maintenance
Calibration settings lost if stored in Windows and OS is reinstalled

decision_boundaries.description: Uncalibrated touch panel in industrial environment can lead to production errors, quality issues, or safety concerns from incorrect operator input.
